intro: Tephroseris heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves exhibit significant variation in shape and size, which is a key feature of its common name. Tephroseris heterophylla is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions.
